ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a user-friendly, AI-enhanced, open-source video editing experience for creating and exporting videos.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Advanced Multi-Track Editing â€¢ Real-Time Preview â€¢ Fast Export â€¢ Vibe AI Assistant â€¢ Smart Media Library
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides an open-source, AI-powered video editing platform that offers advanced multi-track editing, real-time previews, and fast exports. It aims to be a user-friendly alternative to popular tools like Capcut and Canva, with features like an AI assistant for automated edits and a smart media library.

ðŸ”¥ pytgcalls | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Enabling developers to programmatically control and participate in Telegram group voice and video calls within their Python applications.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Async client API for Telegram group voice calls â€¢ Integration with MTProto libraries (Pyrogram, Telethon, Hydrogram) â€¢ Support for voice and video calls in channels and chats â€¢ Functionality for joining as channels or chats
ðŸ“– Summary: PyTgCalls is an asynchronous Python library that enables developers to integrate Telegram group voice call functionalities into their applications. It leverages MTProto and WebRTC, working with popular MTProto libraries like Pyrogram and Telethon to facilitate voice and video calls in channels and chats.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ llm-council | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide more comprehensive and accurate answers to complex questions by aggregating and evaluating responses from multiple LLMs.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Query multiple LLMs simultaneously â€¢ LLM response review and ranking â€¢ Chairman LLM for final response synthesis â€¢ Local web application interface â€¢ Customizable LLM council configuration
ðŸ“– Summary: LLM Council is a local web application that leverages multiple large language models (LLMs) to answer complex questions. It sends queries to various LLMs, has them review and rank each other's responses, and then synthesizes a final answer using a designated 'Chairman' LLM.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ neovate-code | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To act as an AI-powered assistant for developers, automating and improving various aspects of the software development lifecycle.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Code generation â€¢ Bug fixing â€¢ Code review â€¢ Test addition â€¢ Interactive mode
ðŸ“– Summary: Neovate Code is a TypeScript-based coding agent designed to enhance developer workflows. It assists with tasks such as code generation, bug fixing, code review, and test creation, operating in both interactive and headless modes.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ arch-cleaner | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating system maintenance and cleanup for Arch Linux.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ System backup before changes â€¢ Standard and aggressive system updates â€¢ Removal of orphaned & unused packages â€¢ Pacman cache cleaning â€¢ Journal log cleaning
ðŸ“– Summary: Arch-Cleaner is a bash script designed for Arch Linux users to automate routine system maintenance and cleanup tasks. It offers configurable options for updating packages, removing unused files and cache, cleaning logs, and more, with safety features like backups and optional aggressive modes.
